monuments.name: Hamayun's Tomb
monuments.description: Exemplifying the formative stage of the Mughal structural style, Humayun's Tomb stands as a landmark in the development of Mughal architecture, and also represents the earliest extant specimen of the Mughal scheme of the garden tomb, with causeways and channels.

monuments.name: Jama Masjid
monuments.description: Jama Masjid and its courtyard stand on an outcropping more than 30 steps higher than the street, giving the mosque a commanding view of the surrounding area. The longer name, Masjid-i Jahān Numā, translates to “world-reflecting mosque” or “world-displaying mosque.”

amusement parks.name: Disneyland Paris
amusement parks.description: Disneyland Paris is a theme park resort in Marne-la-Vallée, France, known for its fairy tale-themed attractions.

museums.name: Louvre Museum
museums.description: The Louvre is the world's largest art museum and a historic monument in Paris, France.

monuments.name: Tokyo Tower
monuments.description: Tokyo Tower is a communications and observation tower in the Shiba-koen district of Minato, Tokyo, Japan.

amusement parks.name: Tokyo Disneyland
amusement parks.description: Tokyo Disneyland is a theme park located in Urayasu, Chiba, Japan, and is part of the Tokyo Disney Resort.

museums.name: Tokyo National Museum
museums.description: The Tokyo National Museum is Japan's oldest and largest museum, specializing in traditional Japanese art and artifacts.

monuments.name: Statue of Liberty
monuments.description: The Statue of Liberty is a colossal neoclassical sculpture on Liberty Island in New York Harbor.

amusement parks.name: Coney Island
amusement parks.description: Coney Island is a neighborhood in Brooklyn, New York City, known for its amusement parks and beach.

museums.name: Metropolitan Museum of Art
museums.description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art is one of the largest and most prestigious art museums in the world, located on the eastern edge of Central Park.
